snippet: Afghanistan’s foreign donors are expected to take up the human rights community’s furious reaction to President Hamid Karzai’s recent appointment of five new commissioners.
abstract: Afghanistan’s foreign donors, who are expected to respond to outcry over Pres Hamid Karzai's questionable appointment of five human rights commissioners, are meeting to assess whether his government is living up to agreed-upon benchmarks on promoting good government and combating corruption; are likely to conclude that he is not, decision that may cause Afghanistan to lose billions of dollars in international reconstruction aid.
